articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey said on Wednesday that a deadly attack was carried out at the headquarters of Turkish Aerospace Industries (TUSAS) near Ankara, while media reported a loud explosion at the site and showed footage of an exchange of gunfire there.
articles.title: Turkey says some dead, injured after attack at state aviation site

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: There were no immediate reports of casualties. Israeli authorities said air sirens were activated in areas southeast of Tel Aviv.
articles.title: Hezbollah says launches volley of rockets into Israel, Blinken returns seeking ceasefire

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, James Oliphant
articles.description: Nearly 25 million voters have cast ballots, either through in-person early voting or mail-in ballots, according to tracking data from the Election Lab at the University of Florida.
articles.title: Nearly 25 million votes already cast as Harris, Trump hit battleground states

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Bangladesh’s interim government has officially banned the Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL), the student wing of ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina's Awami League party, declaring it a "terrorist organisation".
articles.title: Bangladesh bans student wing of ousted Sheikh Hasina's party

articles.author: James Redmayne, Catarina Demony
articles.description: The leaders of the Commonwealth group of nations will meet at a welcome banquet in Samoa in the South Pacific on Thursday, with climate change and reparations for Britain's role in the transatlantic slave trade on the agenda of summit discussions.
articles.title: Commonwealth nations to discuss slavery reparations, climate change

articles.author: Farah Master
articles.description: China's state security ministry said foreign spy intelligence agencies have been trying to steal secrets from the country's space programme as the arms race in space intensifies and emerges as a new "battlefield for military struggle".
articles.title: China says foreign spies trying to steal space program secrets

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: World powers meet in Paris on Thursday aiming to provide urgent humanitarian aid to Lebanon, support to its security forces and push for a ceasefire, but with the U.S. focused on its own efforts, diplomats said they expect little concrete progress.
articles.title: Few expectations as France convenes partners for Lebanon support

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Biden administration is trying to provide Ukraine with $10 billion in military aid as part of its $20 billion commitment to the country under a $50 billion loan coordinated with the G7 and European Union, the White House National Security Council said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US govt wants half of its $20 billion loan to Ukraine to be military aid

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. Republican Senator Lindsey Graham said he spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday and believed that an agreement to normalize relations between Israel and Saudi Arabia could be reached before the end of the year.
articles.title: US Senator Graham says Israel-Saudi deal possible before year-end

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: New Zealand is looking to return to operation one of its idled offshore patrol vessels after a specialist dive ship sank this month, a defence spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: New Zealand military eyes patrol ship to replace dive vessel that sank
